# 4a) Choose time horizons | fitting vs forecasting

```{r forecast_horizon, out.width = "90%", out.height = "90%"}

# sz <- function(mu, var) {
#   mu^2 / (var - mu)
# }
# 
# sz(1000, 100000) ~= 10

## data
TT <- 30
tt <- seq(TT)
dd <- rnbinom(TT, mu = 15, size = 30)

## plot
par(mai = c(1, 1, 0.1, 1), omi = rep(0, 4))

plot(
  tt, dd,
  type = "o", pch = 19,
  cex = 1.5, cex.axis = 1.2, cex.lab = 1.5,
  las = 1, bty = "n",
  ylab = "Total returns (1000s)", xlab = "Time",
  lwd = 2, col = "dodgerblue"
)
arrows(
  x0 = 30, y0 = -2, x1 = 30, y1 = 0.5,
  length = 0.1, angle = 25, code = 2,
  col = "darkred", lwd = 2,
  xpd = NA
)
text(
  x = 30, y = -2, pos = 1,
  labels = "We are here", cex = 1.5,
  col = "darkred",
  xpd = NA
)
```


---

class: center

# Balanced but perhaps overly optimistic

```{r forecast_1515, out.width = "90%", out.height = "90%"}

## plot
par(mai = c(1, 1, 0.1, 1), omi = rep(0, 4))

plot(
  tt, dd,
  type = "n", cex.axis = 1.2, cex.lab = 1.5,
  las = 1, bty = "n",
  ylab = "Total returns (1000s)", xlab = "Time"
)
## fitting
lines(
  tt[1:15], dd[1:15],
  type = "o", pch = 19, cex = 1.5, lwd = 2,
  col = "dodgerblue"
)
text(
  x = 8, y = 25, pos = 1,
  labels = "Fitting", cex = 1.5,
  col = "dodgerblue",
  xpd = NA
)
## prediction
lines(
  tt[16:TT], dd[16:TT],
  type = "o", pch = 21, cex = 1.5, lwd = 2,
  col = "dodgerblue", bg = "white"
)
text(
  x = 23, y = 0, pos = 1,
  labels = "Prediction", cex = 1.5,
  col = "dodgerblue",
  xpd = NA
)
```


---

class: center

# Fitting-focused but evaluation challenged

```{r forecast_2505, out.width = "90%", out.height = "90%"}

## plot
par(mai = c(1, 1, 0.1, 1), omi = rep(0, 4))

plot(
  tt, dd,
  type = "n", cex.axis = 1.2, cex.lab = 1.5,
  las = 1, bty = "n",
  ylab = "Total returns (1000s)", xlab = "Time"
)
## fitting
lines(
  tt[1:25], dd[1:25],
  type = "o", pch = 19, cex = 1.5, lwd = 2,
  col = "dodgerblue"
)
text(
  x = 13, y = 25, pos = 1,
  labels = "Fitting", cex = 1.5,
  col = "dodgerblue",
  xpd = NA
)
## prediction
lines(
  tt[26:TT], dd[26:TT],
  type = "o", pch = 21, cex = 1.5, lwd = 2,
  col = "dodgerblue", bg = "white"
)
text(
  x = 28, y = 0, pos = 1,
  labels = "Prediction", cex = 1.5,
  col = "dodgerblue",
  xpd = NA
)
```

# 4b) Choose time horizons | steps ahead?

```{r forecast_ahead, out.width = "90%", out.height = "90%"}

## plot
par(mai = c(1, 1, 0.1, 1), omi = rep(0, 4))

plot(
  tt, dd,
  type = "n", cex.axis = 1.2, cex.lab = 1.5,
  las = 1, bty = "n",
  ylab = "Total returns (1000s)", xlab = "Time"
)
## fitting
lines(
  tt[1:25], dd[1:25],
  type = "o", pch = 19, cex = 1.5, lwd = 2,
  col = "dodgerblue"
)
text(
  x = 13, y = 25, pos = 1,
  labels = "Fitting", cex = 1.5,
  col = "dodgerblue",
  xpd = NA
)
arrows(
  x0 = 25, y0 = -2, x1 = 25, y1 = 0.5,
  length = 0.1, angle = 25, code = 2,
  col = "darkred", lwd = 2,
  xpd = NA
)
text(
  x = 25, y = -2, pos = 1,
  labels = "We are here", cex = 1.5,
  col = "darkred",
  xpd = NA
)
## prediction
points(
  tt[26:TT], rep(17, 5),
  pch = "?", cex = 1.5, lwd = 2,
  col = "dodgerblue", bg = "white"
)
# text(
#   x = 28, y = 0, pos = 1,
#   labels = "Prediction", cex = 1.5,
#   col = "dodgerblue",
#   xpd = NA
# )
```
